page.title: 14BILLERICAY NW Trade 2.
page.content: {Gooseberry Green Roundabout. A group of shops, serving local needs, has grown up at the junction of Radford Way and Perry Street. These include a newsagent, a hardware store, a greengrocer and a butcher. The only public house within the grid is also sited at this junction. It is a modern building called "The Pilgrim", a reference to Billericay's association with the Pilgrim Fathers who sailed in the Mayflower. {Radford Way { }The approach to the railway station has its own row of shops. These include a hairdresser, bookshop, plumbers' supplies, fishing tackle, car spare parts and a newsagent. A garage/petrol station is well sited for the station car parks.
